name: Revolution Robotics
description:
Description

In revolution robotics you play as a new apprentice to the crazy Doctor Heinz Heisenberg, his state-of-the-art utility robots have gone rogue and are destroying the facility, you have about ten minutes until they break in, find the randomized kill code and disable the robots, good luck and god have mercy.

This game was created as an assignment for college, we were tasked with creating a game for an escape room company as an industry response. the company gave us criteria to follow and occasional check ups on the progress of the game. This is the final finished product 

Controls
  • WASD / Left Gamepad Joystick – Movement
  • Mouse/Right Gamepad Joystick – Look
  • E/Gamepad Bottom Face Button – Interact
  • Left Mouse Button/Right Trigger – Pick Up Physics Objects
  • Scroll Wheel – Change Pick Up Distance
The Team

Alex, 17 – I did the programming and the environmental design. All of the interactable stuff and game mechanics were all me, after college I’m going to university to continue programming. During this project I learnt a whole lot to do with blueprints which allowed me to make a successful game. As well I also did some environmental design in that I placed all of the actors edited the environment I sourced to create a good area for play.

Dylan, 18 – During the production of Revolution Robotics I was the primary 3D Artist, I modelled, rigged, animated, working on this project was a very valuable experience for me as it allowed me to know what it feels like to work on a real game, it was also a great chance to experiment some techniques in my modelling. After college I’m going to university to do a modelling and animation course. Whilst I’m focusing on my 3D Skills I do love every aspect of game design and like any game development student my dream is to one day have an indie studio of my own
